title: BioShock™ 2 Remastered

notes:
The game works out of the box if you gonna play with an Xbox 360 controller. 
If you gonna play with keyboard and mouse, You gonna need an Xbox controller anyway for to pass the "Press Space to Continue" screen. The button "A" of the Xbox controller do the job.

In other words, this is what I did and what I do for to play this game with keyboard and mouse: Open Steam, plug the wired Xbox 360 controller, open the game normally, start a new game (or hit "continue" or load a save game) and, when the "Press Space to Continue" is on the screen, push the "A" button of the Xbox 360 controller and voilá, I have Bioshock 2 Remastered running on Linux with a native performance.

Maybe You gonna need to modify the files Bioshock2SP.ini and User.ini as I did for to improve performance and comfort. 
If You want to modify these files two files, the info of the legacy Bioshock 2 can be used as reference. https://pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/BioShock_2 
This trick worked for me. I don't know others.
My Steam profile https://steamcommunity.com/id/Digital_CHE/games/?tab=recent
title: BioShock™ 2 Remastered

notes: Works perfectly for me with mouse and keyboard, didn't need any tinkering apart from a launch setting "PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 %command% -nointro".
title: BioShock™ 2 Remastered

notes: I tested using `PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 %command%`. Use a controller to go past "Press space to continue" screen (I tested with XBox One S controller). Then you can turn off controller in Options, and the game seems to run great from now on.
title: BioShock™ 2 Remastered

notes: Game works fine, gamepad (Xbox) and keyboard works, but there is no input with the mouse
title: BioShock™ 2 Remastered

notes: Got stuck on press "space" at the begging. After set launch setting to "PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 %command% -nointro" it works as expected
title: BioShock™ 2 Remastered

notes: Runs only with gamepad not accepting input from mouse/keyboard. Textures of many objects are loaded in very low resolution. The performance is not ideal.
title: BioShock™ 2 Remastered

notes: Needs controller (Steam Controller in my case) to bypass Loading screen, Can use mouse/keyboard in game just fine after this. Seems to have texture loading issues, everything is low quality. Performance is 100+ FPS, maxed, 2560x1440
title: BioShock™ 2 Remastered

notes: "PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 %command%" option used but game got stuck when starting a new game on "press space to continue" screen
title: BioShock™ 2 Remastered

notes:
After disabling Esync and removing the intro, it runs flawlessly, albeit with small stuttering on loading new areas.
PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 %command% -nointro
title: BioShock™ 2 Remastered

notes: Had to add -nointro to launch options to get pass loading screen without a game pad. There's some sync artifacts on screen (black lines).
title: BioShock™ 2 Remastered

gpu: X.Org AMD Radeon R9 200 Series (HAWAII, DRM 3.23.0, 4.15.0-34-generic, LLVM 8.0.0)
notes: Would load loading image then not load into the game. Disabling Esync did nothing
title: BioShock™ 2 Remastered

notes: Disabled esync  and added -nointro to launch options. No issues, except 3 or 4 crashes in +/- 10 hours of play (considering the many people complaining about crashes with this game on Windows, this doesn't seem too bad) and changing the brightness does not work.
